alert.note: Alert for Wayne; Wilson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 31 at 4:53PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Wayne, southwestern Wilson and southeastern Johnston Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 453 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Walnut Creek, or near Goldsboro, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Goldsboro, Mount Olive, Fremont, Walnut Creek, Micro, Pine Level, Kenly, Princeton, Stantonsburg and Pikeville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This thunderstorm is producing an excessive amount of deadly cloud to ground lightning. Seek shelter indoors and stay away from windows. If you cannot seek shelter indoors, an enclosed vehicle can provide safe shelter. Deadly lightning strikes can occur well ahead of an approaching storm, prior to the arrival of rain and wind.
